Bilateral chronic serous otitis media.context: Preoperative Diagnosis: Bilateral chronic serous otitis media.

persistent recurrent infections.context: The patient had a long history of persistent recurrent infections and was placed on antibiotics for the same.

antibiotics.context: The patient had a long history of persistent recurrent infections and was placed on antibiotics for the same.

thick mucoid material.context: At this point in time, he had a small amount of thick mucoid material in both middle ear spaces with middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed, but no active acute infection at this point in time.

middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed.context: At this point in time, he had a small amount of thick mucoid material in both middle ear spaces with middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed, but no active acute infection at this point in time.

no active acute infection.context: At this point in time, he had a small amount of thick mucoid material in both middle ear spaces with middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed, but no active acute infection at this point in time.

foul cerumen.context: With the patient under adequate general anesthesia with the mask delivery of anesthesia, he had his ear canals cleaned utilizing an operating microscope and all foul cerumen had been removed from both sides.

Floxin drops.context: Floxin drops were then instilled bilaterally to decrease any clotting within the tubes, and then cotton ball was placed in the external meatus bilaterally.
